title: Men's Weights
question_text:
The statistics below provide a summary of the distribution of weight, in pounds, from a sample of one hundred adult men:
Minimum: $138\text{ pounds}$ First Quartile: $153\text{ pounds}$ Median: $171\text{ pounds}$ Third Quartile: $192\text{ pounds}$ Maximum: $213\text{ pounds}$
Which of the following statements is always FALSE?

choices.text: $75$ of the men in this sample weigh at least $192\text{ pounds}$.
$25$ of the men in this sample weigh, at most, $153\text{ pounds}$.
50 of the men in this sample can weigh, at most, 171 pounds.

50
of the men in this sample can weigh at least 171 pounds
.

25
of the men in this sample weigh at least
192
 pounds
.

solution:
Choice 'A' is false statement.
192
pounds represents the third quartile. The third quartile is the cutoff for the bottom
75
%
to the top
25
%
, meaning
25
of the men in this sample weigh at least
192
pounds.

Choice 'B' is not always a false statement. For instance,
53
pounds represents the first quartile. The first quartile is the cutoff for the bottom
25
%
to the top
75
%
, meaning that their could be
25
men in this sample weigh at most
153
pounds.

Choice 'C' is a true statement.
171
pounds represents the median value, which indicates the value in the middle
50
%
. The question that may be asked is, why is "at most" used instead of "less than," since there is an even number of values. This is because when we find the median of an even number of values, we have to average the two middle numbers, which could both be
171
pounds.

Choice 'D' is a true statement.
171
pounds represents the median value. The question that may be asked is, why use "at least" and not "greater than," since there is an even number of values? When we find the median of an even number of values, we have to average the two middle numbers, which could both be
171
pounds.

Choice 'E' is a not always a false statement.
192
pounds represents the third quartile. The third quartile is the cutoff for the bottom
75
%

25
%
meaning we could have
25
of the men in this sample that weigh at least
192
pounds.
